eadid.publicid: -//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NcD::Harry Flood Byrd papers, 1928 //EN

titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Harry Flood Byrd papers, 1928
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, January 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection consists of three letters; two are concerned with a speech Byrd was to make to the Lions Club Convention on the proposed amendments to the Virginia Constitution. The third item is an invitation to a farewell dinner given for Commander Richard Evelyn Byrd by the Byrd Aviation Associates for the Byrd Antartic Expedition in New York on July 25, 1928.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Harry Flood Byrd Papers, 1928, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Newspaper editor and political leader of Democratic Party in Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of three letters; two are concerned with a speech Byrd was to make to the Lions Club Convention on the proposed amendments to the Virginia Constitution. The third item is an invitation to a farewell dinner given for Commander Richard Evelyn Byrd by the Byrd Aviation Associates for the Byrd Antartic Expedition in New York on July 25, 1928.
